## IPAT

:::{style="text-align: center"}
$I(mpact) = P(opulation) \times A(ffluence) \times T(echnology)$

$I(mpact) = \frac{P(opulation) \times A(ffluence)}{T(echnology)}$

- Technology: renewable energy, energy efficiency, innovations
:::

::: footer
Source: @ehrlich_impact_1971
:::


## Kaya identify{.smaller}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
$F=P \times \frac{G}{P} \times \frac{E}{G} \times \frac{F}{E}$

<p style="font-size:10pt">
Where:

- F: global CO2 emissions from human sources
- P: global population
- G: world GDP
- E: global energy consumption

And:

- G/P: GDP per capita
- E/G: energy intensity of the GDP
- F/E: emission intensity of energy
</p>

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

![]({{< var file_path >}}/images/kaya-identity-co2.png){fig-align="center"}
:::

:::

::: footer
Source: @kaya_environment_1997, [Kaya Identity: drivers of COâ‚‚ emissions in the World](https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/kaya-identity-co2)
:::

## Case study: Empire State Building retrofit{.smaller}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
- Save 38% of energy use with a 3-year payback
- Remanufacturing 6,500 windows onsite into super windows
- Installing better lights and equipment
- Envelope improvements and reduced internal loads allowed for a smaller cooling system
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
![]({{< var file_path >}}/images/ESB_CaseStudy_2009.jpg){fig-align="center"}
:::

:::

::: footer
Source: Read more from RMI [case study](https://rmi.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Buildings_Retrofit_EmpireStateBuilding_CaseStudy_2009.pdf). 
:::
